Since Student_D is a sure match to us now and is on our acceptable list, accepting secures filling our seat rather than risking ending unmatched by waiting.

I appreciate any guidance you can provide.

Student_E

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for your thoughtful questions.

1) At this point, we are not in a position to offer a seat immediately. We may have capacity that could become available depending on how higher-priority students’ decisions and other schools’ outcomes unfold, but we cannot treat the place as finalized for any candidate until those uncertainties resolve.

2) For your candidacy to be reconsidered for an offer, the key change would be that we are able to extend an offer after higher-priority students either match elsewhere or are no longer in a position to take our seat. In terms of process, submitting an [APPLY] is the only action that can result in an offer in a given round; sending [TALK] messages helps us understand your continued interest, but it does not create an acceptance on its own.

If School_E remains your first choice, you are welcome to submit an [APPLY] again in a future round when you are ready. At the same time, we strongly encourage you to continue pursuing other schools as well, since we cannot guarantee that an opening will occur.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[TALK]
